section.name: XDoclet extensions
section.p: XDoclet is a framework that makes it possible to generate code from special Javadoc tags present in source code. genesis' development started when the most recent XDoclet version available was 1.2.0 and several resources were still not part of it, especially when it came to its Hibernate integration.

To work around those limitations, genesis' distribution contained some modified XDoclet modules for a while. As XDoclet itself evolved, some new features eventually became part of it, but the way the extensions present in genesis were being distributed prevented features from the overridden modules to be used - both from the validation and hibernate modules. Since genesis 2.2, this distribution has been modified so it is easier to use both features that are part of the original XDoclet as well as the ones made available by genesis.
The current version of the extensions contains all features that are part of XDoclet 1.2.2 and some modifications as explained below.

section.name: genesis module
section.p: Commons Validator was originally part of Struts and that is why the support provided by XDoclet is limited to using Commons Validator with this web framework. That is the reason tags that generate the Commons Validator xml file are prefixed by @struts. and have an explicit dependency on Struts classes.

The XDoclet extension module named genesis provides tags with the same semantics as the @struts.validator* tags, except the tags' names begin with @genesis.validator and they work with POJOs instead of requiring the annotated classes to extend a Struts class. An example of how to use these tags can be found in the documentation about validation support.

section.name: hibernate module
section.p: The hibernate module supports some new features that are not available in the original module bundled with XDoclet. The main ones are support for generating the meta element by using the @hibernate.meta tag, definition of many-to-one relationships with tables with composite keys, external queries merging and also component mapping merging. For more infomation, please refer to the issue submitted to the XDoclet project that describes the changes made by the genesis team.
